wordoftheday.definition: Abierto means open in Spanish.
Angry is a feeling you get when you are very upset and mad about something. Missing out on recess made him angry.
Ball is a round object that is fun to play with, especially in games. I shot the ball twice during our basketball game.
Bat is a long object used to hit a ball in a game like baseball. When it was my turn, I picked up the bat and got ready to hit the ball.
Big means something that is large in size.
Bike is something with two wheels that you ride by pushing two pedals with your feet. I rode my bike to the library.
Bus is a large vehicle which can carry many people from place to place. I ride the bus to school.
Cat is a small, soft, and furry animal with a tail, whiskers, and sharp claws. Cats are often kept as pets. My cat Larry likes to sleep on my lap.
Casa means house in Spanish.
Cerrado means closed in Spanish.
Chopsticks are two thin sticks that are held in one hand and used to eat food. I eat my Chinese food with chopsticks.
Elevator is something that carries people up and down to different floors of buildings. My dad and I took the elevator to our apartment on the 10th floor.
Escuela means school in Spanish.
Feliz means happy in Spanish.
Fox is a wild animal that looks like a dog and has reddish-brown fur and a thick, bushy tail. We saw a fox running through the woods.
Gato means cat in Spanish.
Gracias means thank you in Spanish.
Hola means hello in Spanish.
Knee is the middle part of your leg that bends. When I tripped and fell, I scraped my knee.
Laundromat is a place to wash and dry your dirty laundry, such as clothes, towels, and sheets. I went to the laundromat to wash my dirty clothes.
Leche means milk in Spanish.
Libro means book in Spanish.

Milk is a white-colored drink that comes from cows, goats, and sheep and helps to build strong bones and teeth. Milk is also used to make butter, cheese, and yogurt. I drink milk with dinner every night.
Noodles are long, thin pieces of pasta. Noodles are my favorite food.
Octopus is a creature that lives underwater and has eight long tentacles. I drew a picture of an octopus that lives in the ocean.
Open means that a shop, office, or building has its doors unlocked with people working in it. The store was open when we got there.
Salta means jump in Spanish.
Sí y no means yes and no in Spanish.
Siesta means nap in Spanish.
Stop means to no longer do something you have been doing. My mom always stops her car at the stop sign.
Telephone is something you use to talk to someone in another place by pressing numbers. I call my grandmother on the telephone.
Zoo is a place where animals live and are taken care of so that people can come look at them. Our class took a field trip to the zoo.
Ant means a small crawling bug that lives in a large group. I saw a row of ants crawl into a small hole in the ground.
Balloons are made of rubber and when blown up or filled with air, are round like balls and may float away. Dog blew up a balloon and let it float away.
Banana means a long curved fruit with a yellow skin. Monkey’s favorite fruit is a banana.
Bell means something that makes a ringing sound which attracts people’s attention. Frog and his friends like to hear the ding-dong sound that the bell makes.
Bird means a creature with feathers and wings. A bird flew around in the sky and landed on my bedroom window.
Boat means something people ride on to travel across the water. Pig and Frog got in a boat and rowed across the river.
Book means pieces of paper, usually with words or pictures, which are inside a cover of strong paper or cardboard. Frog reads a book to Duck every day.
Box means a container that you can put things in. Sometimes, it has a lid to cover it. Cat keeps all of her letter O’s in a box.
Cake means a sweet food made by mixing flour, eggs, sugar, and fat, and then baking it. Pig baked a cake for Dog on his birthday.
Candle means a stick of hard wax with a piece of string through the middle that you can light. Frog blew out the candle on his birthday cake.
Castle means a large building with thick high walls, built by kings long ago. Shark pretended to be a king and asked Duck to make a sand castle for him to live in.
Clock means something that shows you what the time is. Frog checks the clock to see if it is time for him to get up.
Coat means a piece of clothing with long sleeves worn over your other clothes when you go outside. When it rains, Frog puts on a rain coat to keep himself from getting wet.
Cookie means a small, sweet, flat cake. Pig’s favorite cookies are the ones with chocolate chips in them.
Crown means a something fancy, usually shaped like a circle with jewels, that kings or queens wear on their heads. Bear put a crown on her head and pretended to be a princess.
Drum means a musical instrument that you hit with sticks or your hands to make a beat. In the band, Dog plays the drum while others sing.
Dust means very small bits of dirt or sand. Frog used a feather duster to clean up the dust in his home.
Hat means a covering that you wear on your head. Sheep wore a tall magician hat over her head.
Kite means an object that you fly in the air at the end of a long string. Pig and friends like to fly a kite when it is windy outside.
Lamp means a light that is turned on by a switch. Frog turns on his bedroom lamp when it starts to get dark outside.
Log means a thick piece of wood cut from a branch or trunk of a tree. A log is a part of a tree trunk, and Frog makes it his home.
Map means a drawing of an area, showing what it looks like from above. Sheep and Bear used a map to find their way out of the jungle.
Nail means a thin piece of metal with that can be hammered into the wall. Frog used nails to put pieces of wood together to make a box.
Nest means a place that birds, insects and other animals make to lay eggs in or give birth to their young in. Duck sleeps in a nest.
Pail means a deep round container with a handle. Sheep fills a pail with water and puts her fish into the pail.
Pie means a baked pastry with meat, vegetables, or fruit. Pig loves to make blueberry pies for his friends to eat.
Pit means a large hole that is dug in the ground. Pig and Ant fell into a pit that they dug in the sand.
Plane means a vehicle with wings and engines which can fly. Frog and friends got on a plane and flew to an island far away.
Pool means a big hole filled with water that has been built for people to swim in. Sheep and friends like to swim in the pool in Dog’s backyard.
Rocket means a space vehicle shaped like a long tube. Little pigs got on a rocket and flew into outer space.
Rope means a very thick cord, made by twisting together several thinner cords. Bear used a rope to pull her friends out of the mud.
Rug means a piece of thick material that you put on the floor and use like a carpet. Frog puts a rug in his bedroom to keep his feet warm.
Ship means a large boat which carries people or things. Duck pretended to be a pirate and sailed across the sea in his pirate ship.
Shoe means an object worn on your feet that cover most of your foot but not your ankle. Frog puts on shoes to keep his feet from getting cold.
Slide means something in a playground that you can slide down. Pig and Ant enjoy going down the slide together in the playground.
Stage means an area where people perform. Sheep invited her friends to dance with her onstage.
Tent means a place where people sleep when they are camping. It is made of strong fabric held up by poles. Frog and Dog slept in a tent on their camping trip.
Truck means a vehicle that can be used to carry big loads. Sheep put trash at the back of the truck and drove it down the street.
Vine means a long plant that looks like a rope. Duck likes to swing on a vine like monkeys do.
Water means a clear liquid with no taste. It falls from clouds as rain. On a hot day, Bear drinks plenty of water and takes a shower to cool off.
Camouflage means the way some animals are colored and shaped to blend in with what’s around them. Some animals use camouflage to hide from their enemies.
Chuckle means to laugh quietly or softly. I always chuckle when Leona does something funny.
Exercise means something you do to get fit or stay healthy. Playing ball is a fun way to exercise.
Loud means that someone or something makes a lot of noise. When I play the drums, they are very loud.
Noisy means that something makes a loud sound. The noisy fire truck woke me up.
Quiet means that someone or something makes only a little bit of noise. Mom likes us to be quiet at bedtime. Shhh.
Cool means slightly cold and also means something that’s awesome. A cool breeze feels good on a hot day. Cliff Hanger books are so cool!
Brave means doing something even though you may be scared. The doctor said I was brave because I didn’t cry when I had to get a shot.
Scared means that you are afraid of someone or something. Leona was scared of the monsters in the story.
Thunderstorm means a storm with thunder, lightning, and rain. Leona thought the thunderstorm was loud and scary.
Hum means to make a low, steady noise. My Dad likes to hum along to songs on the radio.
Instrument means an object that you play to make music. The drums are my favorite instrument.
Saxophone means a curved instrument which you blow into to make music. My friend plays the saxophone in a band.
Enormous means very, very big. Many dinosaurs were enormous!
Solar system means the sun and all the planets that go around it. The Earth is part of the solar system.
Telescope means a tube with lenses that makes things that are far away seem larger and closer. Leona and I use our telescope to see the stars in the sky.

Juggle means to entertain people by throwing things into the air, catching each one and throwing it up again so there are several of them in the air at the same time. My friend can juggle 3 balls in the air without dropping them.
Dinosaur means a large reptile that lived millions of years ago. Tyrannosaurus Rex was a huge meat-eating dinosaur.
Cook means to make and heat food. Dad is going to cook hamburgers for dinner.
Knead means to press and squeeze dough with your hands to make it smooth. Dad taught me how to knead dough to make bread.
Raw means food that has not been cooked. That hamburger meat is raw.
Tasty means food that is delicious. Pizza is tasty but wheaty meat treats are even tastier.
Mammal means an animal that gives birth to babies instead of laying eggs, and feeds its babies with milk. Peoples, dogs, and cats are all mammals.
Adventure means when something unusual or exciting happens. The day we explored the jungle was a big adventure.
Contest means a game or competition. My sister and I have a contest to see who can blow the biggest bubbles.
Doodle drawing a little scribble while thinking of something else. Bailey likes to doodle on paper while he watches TV.
Emperor means a man who rules a big area. I like to pretend that I’m the emperor of the world.
Foggy means the air outside is cloudy and hard to see through. It was so foggy that I could barely see the mountain.
Garden means an area outside with plants, flowers, vegetables, and maybe trees. My family’s garden has red and yellow flowers.
Goal means something you want to do. My goal is to learn how to swim.
Grumpy means being in a bad mood or acting unhappy. The rain made me grumpy.
Instructions tell you how to do something. We read the instructions and they told us how to play the game.
Invisible means something cannot be seen. Nobody could see my pretend friend because he was invisible.
Island means a piece of land that has water all around it. We lived in a house on an island in the middle of the ocean.
Palace means a very large, fancy house, especially the home of a king, queen, or president. I drew a picture of a palace with ten swimming pools and twenty bedrooms.
Polite means being nice and having good manners. When I say please and thank you, I feel very polite.
Porridge means a thick, sticky food made from oats, cooked in water or milk and eaten hot, especially for breakfast. I like my porridge with bananas and cinnamon. Yum!
Reflection means seeing yourself, or something else, in a mirror or on top of water. My cat loves to stare at its reflection in the mirror.
Robot means a machine which moves and does some things on its own. I wish I had a robot to clean my room for me.
Rude means not being nice. My brother was rude when he would not let me share his toy.
Seed means one of the small, hard parts of a plant from which a new plant grows. We planted a seed in our yard and now a flower is growing!
Shrink means that something is getting smaller. I poked a hole in the balloon and it began to shrink.
Sturdy means something that is strong. My bed is not sturdy enough for me to jump on it.
Treasure means something that is very special. I like to pretend that I’m hunting for treasure under my bed.
Weed means a wild plant growing where it’s not wanted. My mom spent hours pulling weeds from the garden.
Exclaim means to say something suddenly and loudly because you are excited, shocked, or angry. "It's snowing!" I exclaimed.
Persuade means trying to make someone believe what you're saying. I couldn't persuade Mom to let me stay up later.
Defend means to protect something or stand up for someone. I had to defend myself when my brother said I broke the vase. I was upstairs when it happened.
Outstanding means means someone or something that is really, really great. My teacher said I did an outstanding job on my spelling test.
Unique means one of a kind. My drawings are unique.
Extraordinary means something or someone that is really good or special. The sandcastle I built is extraordinary.
Gift means being able to do something really well. My mom has a gift for singing.
Talent means being able to do something really well. My sister has a talent for playing soccer.
Expertmeans a person who is really good at something or knows a lot about it. My dad is an expert on animals.
Knack means being able to do something difficult easily. My friend has a knack for putting puzzles together.
Evidence means something that helps prove something is true or really happened. I searched my room for evidence that my brother had been there.
Chores mean little jobs you do to help out around the house. My chores are sweeping the floor and walking the dog.
Suspicious means someone who makes you think that they might be doing something bad or lying. The way he kept watching the door seemed suspicious.
Plot means a secret plan to do something bad or wrong. The bad guys had a plot to steal all the cookies from the store.
Danger means something that can hurt someone. There was a sign next to the fire that said "Danger!"
Courageous means someone who does something dangerous, even though they're afraid. Firefighters are courageous when they put out fires.
Protect means to make sure something doesn't get hurt. Our dog protects us by barking at strange noises.
Hero means someone who is admired for being brave or good. My hero is our neighbor, who took care of a stray dog.
Frightened means being scared. I am frightened of spiders.
Helpful means making something easier for someone else. I put away my toys to be helpful.
Earn means getting something, like money or praise, because you work for it. I earn my allowance by cleaning my room.
Appreciate means seeing the good things about someone and being glad to have them around. I appreciate my teacher because he's so nice.
Opportunity means a chance to do something you want to do. My family has an opportunity to go to a baseball game.
Employ means to give someone a job. My dad will hire someone to mow the lawn.
Success means doing everything that you set out to do. My sister was a success because she put on a play in our backyard.
Limit means to stop something from getting bigger. I limit the number of cookies I eat so I don't get a stomachache.
Reduce means to make something smaller. I'm trying to reduce the number of Frisbees I lose.
Diminish means to make something smaller. The snow will diminish as it gets warm.
Addition means adding one thing to another. With the addition of our new bird, we have five pets.
Improve means to make something better. I can improve my hamburger by adding ketchup.
Develop means that something changes little by little. I want to develop into a good checkers player.
